abstract: The cellphone company, which lost more than a million customers in the last five quarters, named Daniel R. Hesse as chief executive on Tuesday.
snippet: The cellphone company, which lost more than a million customers in the last five quarters, named Daniel R. Hesse as chief executive on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The Sprint Nextel Corporation, the cellphone company that lost more than a million customers in the last five quarters, named Daniel R. Hesse as chief executive on Tuesday, succeeding Gary D. Forsee, who was ousted two months ago.

headline.main: Sprint Nextel Hires a Chief From Its Spinoff
headline.print_headline: Sprint Nextel Hires a Chief From Its Spinoff

abstract: We don’t know everyone who is bidding in the 700-megahertz spectrum auction, but Paul Allen and Echostar have signed up to bid against Google, AT&T and Verizon.
snippet: We don’t know everyone who is bidding in the 700-megahertz spectrum auction, but Paul Allen and Echostar have signed up to bid against Google, AT&T and Verizon.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission has released the list of 266 bidders for its big auction of wireless spectrum that starts next month. There are a few surprises: Echostar, the satellite TV company, and Paul Allen’s Vulcan group are among those registered to bid. (A Vulcan spokesman declined to comment. Echostar hasn’t yet returned a call.)

headline.main: Paul Allen and Echostar Line Up for Spectrum Auction
